findings.message:
Contract locking ether found:
	Contract ArysumToken (0x0c89a1c85af07540be9ea062c4f68ad6c2cfeda8.sol#102-224) has payable functions:
	 - ArysumToken.fallback() (0x0c89a1c85af07540be9ea062c4f68ad6c2cfeda8.sol#212-214)
	But does not have a function to withdraw the ether
findings.name: locked-ether

findings.message:
Version constraint ^0.4.18 contains known severe issues (https://solidity.readthedocs.io/en/latest/bugs.html)
	- DirtyBytesArrayToStorage
	- ABIDecodeTwoDimensionalArrayMemory
	- KeccakCaching
	- EmptyByteArrayCopy
	- DynamicArrayCleanup
	- ImplicitConstructorCallvalueCheck
	- TupleAssignmentMultiStackSlotComponents
	- MemoryArrayCreationOverflow
	- privateCanBeOverridden
	- SignedArrayStorageCopy
	- ABIEncoderV2StorageArrayWithMultiSlotElement
	- DynamicConstructorArgumentsClippedABIV2
	- UninitializedFunctionPointerInConstructor_0.4.x
	- IncorrectEventSignatureInLibraries_0.4.x
	- ExpExponentCleanup
	- EventStructWrongData
	- NestedArrayFunctionCallDecoder.
It is used by:
	- ^0.4.18 (0x0c89a1c85af07540be9ea062c4f68ad6c2cfeda8.sol#1)
findings.name: solc-version

findings.message: solc-0.4.26 is an outdated solc version. Use a more recent version (at least 0.8.0), if possible.
findings.name: solc-version

findings.message: Variable ArysumToken._totalSupply (0x0c89a1c85af07540be9ea062c4f68ad6c2cfeda8.sol#106) is not in mixedCase
findings.name: naming-convention

findings.message:
ArysumToken.ArysumToken() (0x0c89a1c85af07540be9ea062c4f68ad6c2cfeda8.sol#115-122) uses literals with too many digits:
	- _totalSupply = 100000 (0x0c89a1c85af07540be9ea062c4f68ad6c2cfeda8.sol#119)
findings.name: too-many-digits
